noun.description: A person who maintains that the gospel of Christ is a new law entirely supplanting the old (Mosaic) law.

adjective.description: Of or relating to the Neonomians or their views.

origin: Late 17th century; earliest use found in Isaac Chauncy (1632–1712), Independent minister. From ancient Greek νεο- neo- + νόμος nomos + -ian, after antinomian [adjective].
